payroll

Class Company

  • java.lang.Object
    • payroll.Company

  • public class Company
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles all the user commands These commands include adding, removing, processing employee payments, setting hours worked by employee and printing the earning statements of the employees
    Author:
    Prachiti Atigre, Ujani Patel

      private int numEmployee

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Company()
      Default constructor to create an empty array

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(Employee employee)
      Adds the employee to the array of employees Before adding, the grow method is called to check if there is space in the array.
      java.lang.String exportDatabase(java.io.File fileExport)
      This method helps print earning statements of Employee to the exported textFile and calls the print function.
      private int find(Employee employee)
      Helper method to find a an employee in the company database Checks if the profile of the employee entered is equal to the profile of any of the employees already present in the array through the means of a for loop
      private void grow()
      Helper method to grow the capacity of the array by 4 The array has an initial capacity of 4, and it is automatically increased whenever full A new array is created and all the elements from the smaller array are copied to the new array
      java.lang.String print(int index)
      This method helps in printing statements for all employees in the company
      void printByDate()
      This method helps in printing the earning statements for all employees in the company by date
      java.lang.String printByDepartment(int index)
      This method helps in printing the earning statements for all employees in the company by department.
      void processPayments()
      Process payments for all employees Based on whether the employee is a part time, full time or management employee, their payments are calculated
      boolean remove(Employee employee)
      Removes the employee from the array of employees The find method is called to check if the employee exists in the company database If the employee is found, the shiftArray method is called to get rid of the employee
      boolean setHours(Parttime employee)
      Set working hours for a part time employee
      void shiftArray(Employee[] emplist, int index)
      Helper method to move the elements of the array one index down to remove the employee from the array The employee at the index needs to be removed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Company

        public Company()
        Default constructor to create an empty array

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add(Employee employee)
        Adds the employee to the array of employees Before adding, the grow method is called to check if there is space in the array. Once there is space, the employee is added
        Parameters:
        employee - the employee to be added
        Returns:
        true if employee is added, false otherwise

      • exportDatabase

        public java.lang.String exportDatabase(java.io.File fileExport)
        This method helps print earning statements of Employee to the exported textFile and calls the print function.
        Parameters:
        fileExport - which is the textFile that needs to be exported
        Returns:
        if successful, returns Database File has been Exported, otherwise Database File was not exported.

      • find

        private int find(Employee employee)
        Helper method to find a an employee in the company database Checks if the profile of the employee entered is equal to the profile of any of the employees already present in the array through the means of a for loop
        Parameters:
        employee - the employee to be found
        Returns:
        index number of the array at which the employee is present if found, -1 otherwise

      • grow

        private void grow()
        Helper method to grow the capacity of the array by 4 The array has an initial capacity of 4, and it is automatically increased whenever full A new array is created and all the elements from the smaller array are copied to the new array

      • print

        public java.lang.String print(int index)
        This method helps in printing statements for all employees in the company
        Parameters:
        index - index to print Employee statements
        Returns:
        earning statements for all employees in a string format,otherwise null

      • printByDate

        public void printByDate()
        This method helps in printing the earning statements for all employees in the company by date

      • printByDepartment

        public java.lang.String printByDepartment(int index)
        This method helps in printing the earning statements for all employees in the company by department. The print function is called to help print and return in a string format to the SampleController class.
        Parameters:
        index - index of Employee to print Employee statements by date
        Returns:
        employee index to the print function

      • processPayments

        public void processPayments()
        Process payments for all employees Based on whether the employee is a part time, full time or management employee, their payments are calculated

      • remove

        public boolean remove(Employee employee)
        Removes the employee from the array of employees The find method is called to check if the employee exists in the company database If the employee is found, the shiftArray method is called to get rid of the employee
        Parameters:
        employee - the employee to be removed
        Returns:
        true if employee is found and removed, false otherwise

      • setHours

        public boolean setHours(Parttime employee)
        Set working hours for a part time employee
        Parameters:
        employee - the part time employee whose hours need to be set
        Returns:
        true if the hours are less than 100, nonnegative and if the employee is found, false otherwise

      • shiftArray

        public void shiftArray(Employee[] emplist,
                       int index)
        Helper method to move the elements of the array one index down to remove the employee from the array The employee at the index needs to be removed. All elements to the right of it are moved one index to the left, eventually getting rid of the employee at the index
        Parameters:
        emplist - the employees array to be shifted
        index - the index of the employee to be removed
